1.name: Reservoir Dogs
1.description: When a simple jewelry heist goes horribly wrong, the surviving criminals begin to suspect that one of them is a police informant.

2.name: The Mighty Ducks
2.description: A self-centered Minnesota lawyer is sentenced to community service coaching a rag tag youth hockey team.

3.name: Basic Instinct
3.description: A violent police detective investigates a brutal murder that might involve a manipulative and seductive novelist.

4.name: Così fan tutte
4.description: A happily married 24-year-old woman who experiences an inexplicable, rather restless craving to finally live her life intensely, retells her extra-marital escapades to her husband intending to spice up their marriage.

5.name: Unforgiven
5.description: Retired Old West gunslinger William Munny (Clint Eastwood) reluctantly takes on one last job, with the help of his old partner Ned Logan (Morgan Freeman) and a young man, The "Schofield Kid" (Jaimz Woolvett).

6.name: Dracula
6.description: The centuries old vampire Count Dracula comes to England to seduce his barrister Jonathan Harker's fiancée Mina Murray and inflict havoc in the foreign land.

7.name: Aladdin
7.description: A kindhearted street urchin and a power-hungry Grand Vizier vie for a magic lamp that has the power to make their deepest wishes come true.

8.name: A Few Good Men
8.description: Military lawyer Lieutenant Daniel Kaffee defends Marines accused of murder. They contend they were acting under orders.

9.name: Scent of a Woman
9.description: A prep school student needing money agrees to "babysit" a blind man, but the job is not at all what he anticipated.

10.name: Kurenai no buta
10.description: In 1930s Italy, a veteran World War I pilot is cursed to look like an anthropomorphic pig.

11.name: The Last of the Mohicans
11.description: Three trappers protect the daughters of a British Colonel in the midst of the French and Indian War.

12.name: Batman Returns
12.description: Batman returns to the big screen when a deformed man calling himself the Penguin wreaks havoc across Gotham with the help of a cruel businessman.

13.name: Malcolm X
13.description: Biographical epic of the controversial and influential Black Nationalist leader, from his early life and career as a small-time gangster, to his ministry as a member of the Nation of Islam.

14.name: My Cousin Vinny
14.description: Two New Yorkers are accused of murder in rural Alabama while on their way back to college, and one of their cousins--an inexperienced, loudmouth lawyer not accustomed to Southern rules and manners--comes in to defend them.

15.name: A League of Their Own
15.description: Two sisters join the first female professional baseball league and struggle to help it succeed amidst their own growing rivalry.

16.name: The Player
16.description: A Hollywood studio executive is being sent death threats by a writer whose script he rejected, but which one?

17.name: The Bodyguard
17.description: A former Secret Service agent takes on the job of bodyguard to an R&B singer, whose lifestyle is most unlike a President's.

18.name: A River Runs Through It
18.description: The story about two sons of a stern minister -- one reserved, one rebellious -- growing up in rural Montana while devoted to fly fishing.

19.name: Honey, I Blew Up the Kid
19.description: The Szalinski family is back, this time hilarious disaster strikes when an experiment causes their new toddler son to grow many stories tall.

20.name: Newsies
20.description: A musical based on the New York City newsboy strike of 1899. When young newspaper sellers are exploited beyond reason by their bosses they set out to enact change and are met by the ruthlessness of big business.

21.name: Alien³
21.description: After her last encounter, Ellen Ripley crash-lands on Fiorina 161, a maximum security prison. When a series of strange and deadly events occur shortly after her arrival, Ripley realizes that she has brought along an unwelcome visitor.

22.name: The Crying Game
22.description: A British soldier kidnapped by IRA terrorists soon befriends one of his captors, who then becomes drawn into the soldier's world.

23.name: Candyman
23.description: The Candyman, a murderous soul with a hook for a hand, is accidentally summoned to reality by a skeptic grad student researching the monster's myth.

24.name: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York
24.description: One year after Kevin McCallister (Macaulay Culkin) was left home alone and had to defeat a pair of bumbling burglars, he accidentally finds himself stranded in New York City - and the same criminals are not far behind.

25.name: Patriot Games
25.description: When CIA analyst Jack Ryan interferes with an IRA assassination, a renegade faction targets him and his family for revenge.

26.name: Wayne's World
26.description: Two slacker friends try to promote their public-access cable show.

27.name: Sister Act
27.description: When a worldly singer witnesses a mob crime, the police hide her as a nun in a traditional convent where she has trouble fitting in.

28.name: Howards End
28.description: A businessman thwarts his wife's bequest of an estate to another woman.

29.name: Glengarry Glen Ross
29.description: An examination of the machinations behind the scenes at a real estate office.

30.name: Twin Peaks: Fire Walk with Me
30.description: Laura Palmer's harrowing final days are chronicled one year after the murder of Teresa Banks, a resident of Twin Peaks' neighboring town.

31.name: Death Becomes Her
31.description: When a woman learns of an immortality treatment, she sees it as a way to outdo her long-time rival.

32.name: Cool World
32.description: A comic strip femme fatale seeks to seduce her cartoonist creator in order to cross over into the real world.

33.name: Raising Cain
33.description: The oncologist wife of a prominent child psychologist suspects her husband has an unhealthy scientific obsession with their child, unaware of what - or who - is really going on inside his head.

34.name: Bitter Moon
34.description: After hearing stories of her, a passenger on a cruise ship develops an irresistible infatuation with an eccentric paraplegic's wife.

35.name: Sleepwalkers
35.description: A mother-and-son team of strange supernatural creatures move to a small town to seek out a young virgin to feed on.

36.name: Lethal Weapon 3
36.description: Martin Riggs and Roger Murtaugh pursue a former LAPD officer who uses his knowledge of police procedure and policies to steal and sell confiscated guns and ammunition to local street gangs.

37.name: Braindead
37.description: A young man's mother is bitten by a Sumatran rat-monkey. She gets sick and dies, at which time she comes back to life, killing and eating dogs, nurses, friends, and neighbors.

38.name: White Men Can't Jump
38.description: Black and white basketball hustlers join forces to double their chances of winning money on the street courts and in a basketball tournament.

39.name: Buffy the Vampire Slayer
39.description: A flighty teenage girl learns that she is her generation's destined battler of vampires.

40.name: Army of Darkness
40.description: A man is accidentally transported to 1300 A.D., where he must battle an army of the dead and retrieve the Necronomicon so he can return home.

41.name: Chaplin
41.description: A film about the troubled and controversial life of the master comedy filmmaker Charles Chaplin.

42.name: Of Mice and Men
42.description: Two drifters, one a gentle but slow giant, try to make money working the fields during the Depression so they can fulfill their dreams.

43.name: Bad Lieutenant
43.description: While investigating a young nun's rape, a corrupt New York City police detective, with a serious drug and gambling addiction, tries to change his ways and find forgiveness and redemption.

44.name: Universal Soldier
44.description: Private Luc Deveraux and his sadistic sergeant, Andrew Scott, got killed in Viet Nam. The army uses their bodies for a secret project - reanimating dead soldiers as deadly obedient cyborgs. However, their memories come back too.

45.name: Poison Ivy
45.description: A seductive teen befriends an introverted high school student and schemes her way into the lives of her wealthy family.

46.name: Beethoven
46.description: A slobbering St. Bernard becomes the center of attention for a loving family, but must contend with a dog-napping veterinarian and his henchmen.

47.name: Encino Man
47.description: When they find a frozen caveman in their back yard, two high school outcasts thaw him and introduce him to modern life while he in turn gets them to actually enjoy life.

48.name: Jamón Jamón
48.description: When a mother disapproves of her son's lover, she hires an underwear model and former bullfighter to seduce her away.

49.name: L'amant
49.description: In 1929 French Indochina, a French teenage girl embarks on a reckless and forbidden romance with a wealthy, older Chinese man, each knowing that knowledge of their affair will bring drastic consequences to each other.

50.name: Singles
50.description: A group of twenty-something friends, most of whom live in the same apartment complex, search for love and success in grunge-era Seattle.
